page.title: 01LANDSCAPE-BUILDINGS
page.content: {AREAS LANDSCAPE}IS GENTLY PASTORAL ROLLING HILLS{SOUTH OF THE NORTH WEALD {(BOX HILL).}LAND LIES 40m TO 90m ABOVE SEA LEVEL. AREA IS {HEAVILY WOODED } WITH {MANY OAK TREES }AND {HEDGES.}THE {RIVER MOLE FLOOD PLAIN}GOES FROM SOUTH EAST TO NORTH WEST ACROSS AREA.{FIELDS HAVE NOT CHANGED SINCE 1841 AND BEFORE THIS IS CONFIRMED BY TITHE / ORDNANCE SURVEY MAPS (HANDPAINTED 1871).SAID TO BE LEAST CHANGED AREA OF UK.{ {BETCHWORTH ESTATES}HAVE ONLY CHANGED FAMILIES TWICE SINCE 1086.{MANY OLD {BUILDINGS}IN AREA, {FLANCHFORD MILL {(DISUSED)}IS 300 YRS OLD,LAST USED IN 1928,HAS NOT BEEN USED SINCE AS THE WHEEL BROKE. 200 YRS AGO WHEEL WAS THE LARGEST IN S OF ENGLAND.{BETCHWORTH ST {MICHAELS CHURCH},STEEPLE RESTORED,ARCH BUILT BY {NORMANS 1080-1150.}BARN NEAR CHURCH (TO BE RESTORED)BUILT 1700.{ {MANY PILL BOXES NORTH OF RIVER MOLE. }
